trigger_event: Oksana Lintz receives urgent reports of mounting anomalies and trust breakdowns around the Reconciliation Spiral protocol as citizens fear Directorate infiltration, forcing her to choose how much hidden information to reveal.
dilemma: Should Oksana Lintz launch a full public data release, risking chaos but exposing the truth, or should she focus on personal storytelling and guided forums, protecting harmony but leaving system secrets unspoken?
reason: Oksana fears that full exposure will cause uncontrollable panic and division, but hiding the truth may forever poison hopes for genuine reconciliation. Her own low BCI score and conversations with Alex leave her torn between transparency and responsibility.
choice_a: Authorize a full, uncensored data release to all free zones, exposing past abuses and the current sabotage.
belief_a: Only by revealing the whole truth can people make true choices.
The system’s old wounds must be faced, even if it means breaking what order remains.
Transparency is the only check against repetition of the past.
choice_b: Limit audit scope to personal accounts and local forums, guiding the city toward empathy and reconciliation without exposing the raw system data.
belief_b: Lasting reconciliation needs shared experience, not more wounds.
Too much truth at once shatters trust beyond repair.
Guided healing can create unity out of suffering.
